text: Judit Farré-Badia. Author. Francesc Català-Moll. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Farré-Badia J, Català-Moll F (2024). microfunk: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.99.0,  https://microbialgenomics-irsicaixaorg.github.io/microfunk/, https://github.com/MicrobialGenomics-IrsicaixaOrg/microfunk.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal microfunk …

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Get latest stable R release CRAN. install microfunk Bioconductor using following code: development version GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub!
code: library("microfunk") ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: citation output using citation('microfunk') R. Please run check updates cite microfunk. Please note microfunk made possible thanks many R bioinformatics software authors, cited either vignettes /paper(s) describing package.
code: print(citation('microfunk'), bibtex = TRUE) #> Warning in citation("microfunk"): could not determine year for 'microfunk' from #> package DESCRIPTION file #> To cite package 'microfunk' in publications use: #>  #>   Farré-Badia J, Català-Moll F (????). _microfunk: What the Package #>   Does (One Line, Title Case)_. R package version 0.99.0, #>   https://microbialgenomics-irsicaixaorg.github.io/microfunk/, #>   <https://github.com/MicrobialGenomics-IrsicaixaOrg/microfunk>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {microfunk: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)}, #>     author = {Judit Farré-Badia and Francesc Català-Moll}, #>     note = {R package version 0.99.0,  #> https://microbialgenomics-irsicaixaorg.github.io/microfunk/}, #>     url = {https://github.com/MicrobialGenomics-IrsicaixaOrg/microfunk}, #>   }

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Please note microfunk project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Check annotation regrouping validity for abundance data in a SE object — .check_regroup
title: Check annotation regrouping validity for abundance data in a SE object — .check_regroup
text: function checks validity regrouping gene family/pathway abundance data requested target annotation. ensures IDs abundance assay data SE object known belong valid annotation type. , checks UniRef90 IDs present regrouping. Finally, validates target annotation type among supported annotations.

title: Check annotation regrouping validity for abundance data in a SE object — .check_regroup
Check annotation regrouping validity for abundance data in a SE object — .check_regroup
text: se SummarizedExperiment object containing gene/pathway abundance values assay metadata column data. character string specifying target annotation type regrouping. Valid values include "ec" (Enzyme Comission), "eggnog" (evolutionary genealogy genes: Non-supervised Orthologous Groups), "go" (Gene Ontology), "ko" (KEGG Orthology) "pfam" (Protein families database alignments HMMs).

title: Check annotation regrouping validity for abundance data in a SE object — .check_regroup
text: 'NULL' checks pass. issue found, error raised.

title: Check annotation regrouping validity for abundance data in a SE object — .check_regroup
text: checks fail, appropriate error message displayed, function aborts regrouping process.

title: Homogenize Differential Abundance Results — .da_homogenization
text: internal function takes differential abundance analysis results tibble format either DESeq2 MaAsLin2 homogenizes consistent format. function first determines type input (DESeq2/MaAsLin2) based column names calls another internal function create new tibble homogenized column names. input type unrecognized, error raised.

title: Homogenize Differential Abundance Results — .da_homogenization
text: da_result tibble containing differential abundance results. data frame columns corresponding either MaAsLin2 DESeq2 output formats.

title: Homogenize Differential Abundance Results — .da_homogenization
text: homogenized tibble consistent format regardless original DA result format.

title: Homogenize DESeq2 Differential Abundance Results — .deseq_homogenize
text: internal function homogenizes DESeq2 differential abundance (DA) results consistent format specific column names. function processes input tibble ensures output tibble consistent structure columns relevant downstream analysis. fills certain columns placeholder values applicable DESeq2 results.

title: Homogenize DESeq2 Differential Abundance Results — .deseq_homogenize
text: tbl tibble containing DESeq2 DA analysis results.

title: Homogenize DESeq2 Differential Abundance Results — .deseq_homogenize
text: tibble homogenized format.

title: Plot DESeq2 Lollipop Plot — .deseq_lollipop
text: function generates lollipop plot DESeq2 differential abundance analysis results.

title: Plot DESeq2 Lollipop Plot — .deseq_lollipop
text: da_result tibble containing results DESeq2 DA analysis. n Maximum number significant associations displayed plot ascending order p-adjusted value.

title: Plot DESeq2 Lollipop Plot — .deseq_lollipop
text: ggplot2 object representing lollipop plot.

title: Plot DESeq2 Volcano Plot — .deseq_volcano
text: function generates volcano plot DESeq2 differential abundance analysis results.

title: Plot DESeq2 Volcano Plot — .deseq_volcano
text: da_result tibble containing results DESeq2 DA analysis.

title: Plot DESeq2 Volcano Plot — .deseq_volcano
text: ggplot2 object representing volcano plot.

what: Check metadata consistency with HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_metadata_check
title: Check metadata consistency with HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_metadata_check
text: function verifies consistency provided metadata HUMAnN3 file. ensures metadata contains sufficient annotations sample IDs metadata match column names HUMAnN3 file.

title: Check metadata consistency with HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_metadata_check
Check metadata consistency with HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_metadata_check
text: meta_df tibble containing sample metadata. humann_tbl tibble containing data HUMAnN3 output file.

title: Check metadata consistency with HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_metadata_check
text: input metadata tibble checks pass.

what: Check HUMAnN3 output file and metadata input paths — .humann_path_checks
title: Check HUMAnN3 output file and metadata input paths — .humann_path_checks
text: function checks input paths HUMAnN3 output file metadata file exist metadata contained CSV file.

title: Check HUMAnN3 output file and metadata input paths — .humann_path_checks
Check HUMAnN3 output file and metadata input paths — .humann_path_checks
text: file_path Path HUMAnN3 output TSV file. metadata Path metadata CSV file.

title: Check HUMAnN3 output file and metadata input paths — .humann_path_checks
text: 'NULL' input paths pass checks. issue found, error raised.

what: Check validity of the tibble derived from the HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_tbl_checks
title: Check validity of the tibble derived from the HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_tbl_checks
text: function performs several checks tibble: abundance values correspond either '# Gene Family' '# Pathway', empty, contains least two samples column classes (character/numeric) correct.

title: Check validity of the tibble derived from the HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_tbl_checks
Check validity of the tibble derived from the HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_tbl_checks
text: humann_tbl tibble containing data HUMAnN3 output file.

title: Check validity of the tibble derived from the HUMAnN3 output file — .humann_tbl_checks
text: 'NULL' checks pass. issue found, error raised.

title: Homogenize MaAsLin2 Differential Abundance Results — .maaslin_homogenize
text: internal function homogenizes MaAsLin2 differential abundance (DA) results consistent format specific column names. function processes input tibble ensures output tibble consistent structure columns relevant downstream analysis. fills certain columns placeholder values applicable MaAsLin2 results.

title: Homogenize MaAsLin2 Differential Abundance Results — .maaslin_homogenize
text: tbl tibble containing MaAsLin2 DA analysis results.

title: Homogenize MaAsLin2 Differential Abundance Results — .maaslin_homogenize
text: tibble homogenized format.

title: Plot MaAsLin2 Lollipop Plot — .maaslin_lollipop
text: function generates lollipop plot MaAsLin2 differential abundance analysis results.

title: Plot MaAsLin2 Lollipop Plot — .maaslin_lollipop
text: da_result tibble containing results MaAsLin2 DA analysis. n Maximum number significant associations displayed plot ascending order q-value.

title: Plot MaAsLin2 Lollipop Plot — .maaslin_lollipop
text: ggplot2 object representing lollipop plot.

title: Plot MaAsLin2 Volcano Plot — .maaslin_volcano
text: function generates volcano plot MaAsLin2 differential abundance analysis results.

title: Plot MaAsLin2 Volcano Plot — .maaslin_volcano
text: da_result tibble containing results MaAsLin2 DA analysis.

title: Plot MaAsLin2 Volcano Plot — .maaslin_volcano
text: ggplot2 object representing volcano plot.

title: Fetch HUMAnN3 databases — fetch_humann_db
text: function fetches HUMAnN3 databases AWS based provided annotation version. databases exist cache directory, overwrite option enabled, function download databases AWS.

title: Fetch HUMAnN3 databases — fetch_humann_db
code: fetch_humann_db(   annot = c("ec", "eggnog", "go", "ko", "pfam"),   version = "v201901b",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Fetch HUMAnN3 databases — fetch_humann_db
text: annot character vector specifying annotations fetch. Default c("ec", "eggnog", "go", "ko", "pfam"). version character string representing version databases fetch. Default "v201901b". overwrite logical indicating whether overwrite existing files cache directory. Default FALSE.

title: Fetch HUMAnN3 databases — fetch_humann_db
text: invisible TRUE

title: Fetch HUMAnN3 databases — fetch_humann_db
text: function first checks provided annotation valid. , aborts message indicating available annotations. , creates microfunk cache directory exist, checks version compatibility. Finally, fetches databases AWS saves cache directory. overwrite option TRUE, existing files cache directory overwritten.

title: Fetch HUMAnN3 databases — fetch_humann_db
code: # Fetch HUMAnN3 databases with default parameters fetch_humann_db(annot = "test") #>  #> ── Fetching HUMAnN3 databases ────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ Cache directory .microfunk already exists #> ✔ File test_v201901b.tsv.gz cached

what: Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
title: Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
text: function regroups gene family metabolic pathway abundance data stored SummarizedExperiment object annotated UniRef90 IDs (https://www.uniprot.org/help/uniref).

title: Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
text: se SummarizedExperiment object containing gene/pathway abundance values assay metadata column data. character string specifying target annotation type regrouping. Valid values include "ec" (Enzyme Comission), "eggnog" (evolutionary genealogy genes: Non-supervised Orthologous Groups), "go" (Gene Ontology), "ko" (KEGG Orthology) "pfam" (Protein families database alignments HMMs). version character string specifying version database use. Default "v201901b".

title: Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
text: SummarizedExperiment object containing gene/pathway abundance values regrouped according specified annotation assay, metadata column data information regrouped features row data.

title: Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
text: takes inputs SummarizedExperiment object, new annotation method regroup version database use. First, validity inputs checked using .check_regroup() function. , processes abundance data, extracting relevant UniRef90 IDs, ensures necessary database file annotation conversion available, fetching required. function reads files matches abundance data UniRef90 annotation. Finally, merges aggregates data based new annotations constructs new SummarizedExperiment object.

title: Regroup HUMAnN3 Abundance Data in a SummarizedExperiment Object — humann_regroup
code: # Read HUMAnN3 & Regroup to PFAM annotation se_regrouped <- read_humann(   file_path = system.file("extdata", "reduced_genefam_rpk_uniref.tsv", package = "microfunk"),   metadata = system.file("extdata", "reduced_meta.csv", package = "microfunk")   ) %>%   humann_regroup(to = "pfam") #> ✔ File pfam_v201901b.tsv.gz cached

what: Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
title: Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
text: function normalizes gene family pathway abundance data stored SummarizedExperiment object, containing gene/pathway abundance values assay metadata column data (https://bioconductor.org/packages/devel/bioc/vignettes/SummarizedExperiment/inst/doc/SummarizedExperiment.html), either CPM units (copies per million) relative abundance.

title: Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
text: se SummarizedExperiment object containing gene/pathway abundance values assay metadata column data. norm character string specifying normalization method apply. Supported methods 'cpm' copies per million 'relab' relative abundance. .batch_size integer specifying number columns process batch. Default 10.

title: Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
text: updated SE object normalized abundance values assay slot.

title: Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
text: first checks whether requested normalization method supported. , retrieves abundance data assays slot SE object, determines current normalization method applied data (RPK, CPM relative abundance) applies requested normalization needed.

title: Normalize gene family or pathway abundance data in a SummarizedExperiment object — norm_abundance
code: # Def data paths metadata <- system.file("extdata", "ex_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") file_path <-   system.file("extdata", "All_genefam_cpm_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk")  # Read HUMAnN3 & Normalize to Relative Abundance transformed_data <-   read_humann(file_path, metadata) %>%   norm_abundance(norm = "relab")

what: Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
title: Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
text: function generates lollipop plot based results MaAsLin2 DESeq2 analysis visualize differential abundance microbial gene families pathways (features) associated specific categorical variables. includes significant features q-value < 0.05 (MaAsLin2) p-adjusted value < 0.05 (DESeq2).

title: Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
text: da_result tibble containing result differential analysis. n Maximum number significant associations displayed plot ascending order q-value (MaAsLin2) p-adjusted value (DESeq2).

title: Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
text: lollipop plot visualizing differential abundance microbial features.

title: Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
text: x-axis represents coefficient/effect size (MaAsLin2) log2FoldChange (DESeq2) feature, indicating magnitude direction change associated chosen categorical variable. y-axis represents features ordered coefficient values (MaAsLin2) log2FoldChange (DESeq2). feature depicted line segment originating origin (0 x-axis) extending corresponding coefficient/log2FC value x-axis. Negative coefficient/log2FC values indicate decrease abundance, positive ones indicate increase abundance. color feature segment determined statistical significance differences, represented color gradient scale using negative logarithm p-values.

title: Generate a Lollipop Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_lollipop
code: # Def data paths metadata <- system.file("extdata", "ex_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") file_path <- system.file("extdata", "All_genefam_cpm_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk")  # Read HUMAnN3 & MaAsLin2 Analysis da_result <-   read_humann(file_path, metadata) %>%   run_maaslin2(fixed_effects = "ARM")  # Lollipop Plot plt_lollipop(da_result, n = 20) #> ! Features present in all methods are greater than the cutoff n = 20 #> ℹ The top 20 significant features will be used

title: Generate a Volcano Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_volcano
Generate a Volcano Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_volcano

title: Generate a Volcano Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_volcano
text: volcano plot visualizing differential abundance microbial features.

title: Generate a Volcano Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_volcano
text: x-axis represents coefficient/effect size (MaAsLin2 DA) log2FoldChange (DESeq2 DA) feature, indicating magnitude direction change associated chosen categorical variable. y-axis represents statistical significance differences (negative logarithm p-values). point plot corresponds gene family pathway, position determined effect size statistical significance. features q-value < 0.05 (MaAsLin2) p-adjusted value < 0.05 (DESeq2)  deemed significant therefore colored, red abundance increases blue abundance decreases.

title: Generate a Volcano Plot for MaAsLin2 Analysis Results — plt_volcano
code: # Def data paths metadata <- system.file("extdata", "ex_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") file_path <- system.file("extdata", "All_genefam_cpm_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk")  # Read HUMAnN3 & MaAsLin2 Analysis da_result <-   read_humann(file_path, metadata) %>%   run_maaslin2(fixed_effects = "ARM")  # Volcano Plot plt_volcano(da_result) #> Warning: Removed 44 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text_repel()`).

what: Read HUMAnN3 output file and create SummarizedExperiment objects — read_humann
title: Read HUMAnN3 output file and create SummarizedExperiment objects — read_humann
text: function reads HUMAnN3 output file (https://huttenhower.sph.harvard.edu/humann), contains information abundance gene families metabolic pathways given sample TSV format. function performs several checks structure content file, well reading validating metadata CSV file, ensuring contains required information matching sample IDs provided TSV data file. Finally, creates SummarizedExperiment object (https://bioconductor.org/packages/devel/bioc/vignettes/SummarizedExperiment/inst/doc/SummarizedExperiment.html) containing gene/pathway abundance values assay metadata column data.

title: Read HUMAnN3 output file and create SummarizedExperiment objects — read_humann
Read HUMAnN3 output file and create SummarizedExperiment objects — read_humann
text: file_path Path HUMAnN3 output (gene families pathway) collapsed TSV file. file contain aggregated abundance data across multiple samples. row represents unique functional category (gene family / pathway) column corresponds sample. metadata Path CSV file containing sample IDs additional information, row corresponds sample column represents specific annotation associated sample.

title: Read HUMAnN3 output file and create SummarizedExperiment objects — read_humann
text: SummarizedExperiment object containing gene/pathway abundance values assay metadata column data.

title: Read HUMAnN3 output file and create SummarizedExperiment objects — read_humann
code: # Def data paths metadata <-   system.file("extdata", "ex_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") file_path <-   system.file("extdata", "All_genefam_cpm_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk")  # Read HUMAnN3 read_humann(file_path, metadata) #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 81633 214  #> metadata(0): #> assays(1): humann #> rownames(81633): K00001 #>   K00001|g__Acidaminococcus.s__Acidaminococcus_fermentans ... #>   UNGROUPED|unclassified UNMAPPED #> rowData names(0): #> colnames(214): RAG_1 RAG_4 ... RAG_48 RAG_20 #> colData names(1): ARM

title: Run DESeq Analysis — run_deseq2
text: function performs DESeq analysis (https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DESeq2.html) count data, tests differential expression based model using Negative Binomial (Gamma-Poisson) Distribution. function takes gene family/pathway abundance data multiple samples associated metadata contained SummarizedExperiment object, runs analysis according several parameter options applies shrinkage log2-fold changes order improve estimate precision. Finally, returns tibble results indicating significant changes specified experimental conditions.

title: Run DESeq Analysis — run_deseq2
code: run_deseq2(   se,   factor,   design = NULL,   test = "Wald",   fitType = "local",   betaPrior = FALSE,   type = "ashr",   max_significance = 0.05,   log2FC = 0,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Run DESeq Analysis — run_deseq2
text: se SummarizedExperiment object containing normalized abundance values assay metadata column data. factor character string specifying factor/categorical variable use differential expression analysis. column name colData SummarizedExperiment object. design formula. formula expresses counts gene depend variables colData. Many R formula valid, including designs multiple variables, e.g., ~ group + condition, designs interactions, e.g., ~ genotype + treatment + genotype:treatment. See results variety designs extract results tables. test Either "Wald" "LRT", use either Wald significance tests (defined nbinomWaldTest), likelihood ratio test difference deviance full reduced model formula (defined nbinomLRT). fitType Either "parametric", "local", "mean", "glmGamPoi" type fitting dispersions mean intensity. betaPrior Whether put zero-mean normal prior non-intercept coefficients. default set FALSE, shrunken LFCs obtained afterwards using lfcShrink. type character string specifying type shrinkage apply log2-fold changes. Options include "normal", "apeglm", "ashr", etc. Default "normal". max_significance numeric value specifying maximum adjusted p-value (padj) threshold considering feature significant. Default 0.05. log2FC numeric value specifying minimum absolute log2-fold change threshold considering feature significant. Default 0. quiet Whether print messages description. Default TRUE.

title: Run DESeq Analysis — run_deseq2
text: tibble containing log2-fold changes, p-values, p-adjusted values significance indicators feature.

title: Run DESeq Analysis — run_deseq2
code: # Def data paths metadata <-   system.file("extdata", "ex_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") file_path <-   system.file("extdata", "All_genefam_rpk_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk")  # Read HUMAnN3 & DESeq2 Analysis da_result <-   read_humann(file_path, metadata) %>%   run_deseq2(factor = "ARM") #> converting counts to integer mode  # Test number of significant associations da_result %>%   dplyr::filter(signif == TRUE) %>%   nrow() %>%   testthat::expect_equal(41)  # Test P-values da_result %>%   dplyr::pull(p_value) %>%   mean() %>%   round(3) %>%   testthat::expect_equal(0.555)  # Test P-adjusted values da_result %>%   dplyr::pull(padj_value) %>%   mean(na.rm = TRUE) %>%   round(3) %>%   testthat::expect_equal(0.857)  # Read HUMAnN3 & DESeq2 Analysis da_result <- read_humann(   file_path = system.file("extdata", "All_genefam_rpk_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk"),   metadata = system.file("extdata", "ex_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") ) %>% run_deseq2(factor = "ARM") #> converting counts to integer mode  da_result #> # A tibble: 5,016 × 11 #>    feature metadata da_method coefficient   log2FC stderr lfc_stderr p_value #>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>          <dbl> <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 K00001  ARM      deseq2    -            0.00124 -          0.102  0.943   #>  2 K00002  ARM      deseq2    -            0.0194  -          0.0936 0.505   #>  3 K00003  ARM      deseq2    -            0.0611  -          0.0887 0.125   #>  4 K00004  ARM      deseq2    -            0.00778 -          0.275  0.738   #>  5 K00005  ARM      deseq2    -            0.0491  -          0.0904 0.183   #>  6 K00007  ARM      deseq2    -           -0.00345 -          0.268  0.880   #>  7 K00008  ARM      deseq2    -           -0.112   -          0.267  0.00950 #>  8 K00009  ARM      deseq2    -           -0.0272  -          0.102  0.251   #>  9 K00010  ARM      deseq2    -           -0.00643 -          0.0959 0.788   #> 10 K00012  ARM      deseq2    -            0.0587  -          0.0859 0.160   #> # ℹ 5,006 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: q_value <chr>, padj_value <dbl>, signif <lgl>

title: Run MaAsLin2 Analysis Quietly — run_maaslin2
text: function performs MaAsLin2 analysis (https://huttenhower.sph.harvard.edu/maaslin/), finds associations microbiome meta-omics features metadata. Features consist abundance gene families metabolic pathways multiple samples, obtained using HUMAnN3 (https://huttenhower.sph.harvard.edu/humann).

title: Run MaAsLin2 Analysis Quietly — run_maaslin2
code: run_maaslin2(   se,   output = paste0(tempdir(), "/output_folder"),   min_abundance = 0,   min_prevalence = 0.1,   min_variance = 0,   normalization = "NONE",   transform = "NONE",   analysis_method = "LM",   max_significance = 0.25,   random_effects = NULL,   fixed_effects = NULL,   correction = "BH",   standardize = TRUE,   plot_heatmap = TRUE,   heatmap_first_n = 50,   plot_scatter = TRUE,   max_pngs = 10,   save_scatter = FALSE,   save_models = FALSE,   reference = NULL )

title: Run MaAsLin2 Analysis Quietly — run_maaslin2
text: se SummarizedExperiment object containing normalized abundance values assay metadata column data. output Character string specifying output directory path. Default tmp folder. min_abundance Minimum abundance feature. Default 0.0. min_prevalence Minimum percent samples feature detected minimum abundance. Default 0.1. min_variance Minimum variance threshold features included. Default 0.0. normalization Normalization method apply. Default 'NONE'. transform Transformation method used. Default 'NONE'. analysis_method Analysis method apply. Default 'LM'. max_significance Q-value threshold significance. Default 0.25. random_effects Random effects included analysis (comma-delimited multiple effects). Default NULL. fixed_effects Fixed effects included analysis (comma-delimited multiple effects). Default NULL. correction Correction method computing Q-value. Default 'BH'. standardize Apply Z-score continuous metadata scale. Default FALSE. plot_heatmap Generate heatmap significant associations. Default TRUE. heatmap_first_n heatmap, plot top N features significant associations. Default 50. plot_scatter Generate scatter plots significant associations. Default TRUE. max_pngs Set maximum number scatter plots significant associations save png files. Default 10. save_scatter Save scatter plot ggplot objects RData file. Default FALSE. save_models Return full model outputs save RData file. Default FALSE. reference Factor use reference categorical variables, provided string 'variable,reference' (semi-colon delimited multiple variables).

title: Run MaAsLin2 Analysis Quietly — run_maaslin2
text: Results MaAsLin2 analysis tibble.

title: Run MaAsLin2 Analysis Quietly — run_maaslin2
text: function takes SummarizedExperiment object containing normalized gene/ pathway abundance values assay metadata column data, well several parameter options run analysis. creates temporary output folder store created files returns result analysis console.

title: Run MaAsLin2 Analysis Quietly — run_maaslin2
code: # Read HUMAnN3 & MaAsLin2 Analysis da_result <- read_humann(   file_path = system.file("extdata", "reduced_genefam_cpm_kegg.tsv", package = "microfunk"),   metadata = system.file("extdata", "reduced_meta.csv", package = "microfunk") ) %>% run_maaslin2(fixed_effects = "ARM")  da_result #> # A tibble: 3,806 × 11 #>    feature metadata da_method coefficient log2FC stderr lfc_stderr p_value #>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>           <dbl> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>        <dbl> #>  1 K03592  ARM      maaslin2       -0.389 -           0 -                0 #>  2 K03788  ARM      maaslin2       -0.125 -           0 -                0 #>  3 K05708  ARM      maaslin2       -0.189 -           0 -                0 #>  4 K07270  ARM      maaslin2       -0.567 -           0 -                0 #>  5 K08678  ARM      maaslin2       -0.793 -           0 -                0 #>  6 K13652  ARM      maaslin2       -1.08  -           0 -                0 #>  7 K16950  ARM      maaslin2       -1.71  -           0 -                0 #>  8 K20861  ARM      maaslin2       -0.272 -           0 -                0 #>  9 K21055  ARM      maaslin2       -0.588 -           0 -                0 #> 10 K21065  ARM      maaslin2       -0.578 -           0 -                0 #> # ℹ 3,796 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: q_value <dbl>, padj_value <chr>, signif <lgl>
